Internal Developer Platform

A self-service platform for developers to provision infrastructure and deploy applications.

Platform EngineeringBackstageKubernetes

This was an internal project at my company to build a self-service developer platform. Since it’s proprietary, there’s no public repository, but I wanted to document what I learned.

The Problem

Developers were spending too much time on infrastructure tasks instead of writing code. They needed:

  • A way to provision databases without filing tickets
  • Self-service Kubernetes namespace creation
  • Automated CI/CD pipeline generation

Solution

We built an internal developer portal using Backstage as the foundation. Key components included:

  • Service Catalog — A searchable directory of all microservices
  • Software Templates — One-click project scaffolding
  • Tech Docs — Centralized documentation

Technical Implementation

The platform integrated with our existing tools:

  • Terraform Cloud for infrastructure provisioning
  • ArgoCD for GitOps deployments
  • GitHub Actions for CI pipelines
  • Datadog for observability

Results

After rollout, we saw significant improvements:

  • 70% reduction in time to provision new services
  • Developers could deploy to production within their first week
  • Standardized project structure across 50+ microservices

What I’d Do Differently

If starting over, I would:

  1. Start with fewer features and iterate based on feedback
  2. Invest more in documentation from day one
  3. Build better onboarding workflows for new developers
